title: Women’s groups hail Noel Clarke libel defeat as victory for victims and press freedom
description: Campaigners say judgment shows powerful men cannot hide behind money and libel laws to silence accusers
content:
Women’s groups have said a high court judgment dismissing a libel claim against the Guardian by actor Noel Clarke marks a victory not just for his victims, but for press freedom and public interest reporting as a whole.

description: Plans outlined by the Reform UK leader would see the country taken out of the European Convention on Human Rights.
content:

title: NASA spacecraft collects dust older than the sun from an asteroid more than 200million miles away
description: Scientists have analysed samples from the Bennu asteroid (pictured), which resembles the Death Star space station in the Star Wars films, and found it is 'chemically primitive'.
content:
Dust collected from an asteroid by a NASA spacecraft more than 200 million miles away from Earth contains material that is older than the sun.
Scientists have analysed samples from the Bennu asteroid, which resembles the Death Star space station in t... [2313 chars]

title: Migrant hotel protests LIVE: Counter demonstrations face off as tensions soar
description: Anti-migrant protests have become more widespread as campaigners complain about people being housed at the taxpayers' expense with counter demonstrators arguing diversity makes the country stronger
content:

Immigration protesters waving Union flags have faced off with anti-racism demonstrators in Portsmouth city centre.

title: Tributes paid after passing of ‘firm and faithful’ former UUP MP Martin Smyth
description: A former UUP MP who has died has been described as a stalwart of unionism.
content:
A former UUP MP who has died has been described as a stalwart of unionism.
Rev Martin Smyth (94) served as MP for South Belfast from 1982 until 2005.
The Co Down man took the seat after Robert Bradford was murdered by the IRA in November 1981.
